Let us know what you think!

R to @bcherny: /batch

Interactively plan out code migrations, then execute in parallel using dozens of agents.

Each agent runs with full isolation using git worktrees, testing its work before putting up a PR.

Usage: "/batch migrate src/ from Solid to React"
/batch

Interactively plan out code migrations, then execute in parallel using dozens of agents.

Each agent runs with full isolation using git worktrees, testing its work before putting up a PR.

Usage: "/batch migrate src/ from Solid to

R to @bcherny: /simplify

Use parallel agents to improve code quality, tune code efficiency, and ensure CLAUDE.md compliance.

Usage: "hey claude make this code change then run /simplify"
/simplify

Use parallel agents to improve code quality, tune code efficiency, and ensure CLAUDE.md compliance.

Usage: "hey claude make this code change then run /simplify"

In the next version of Claude Code..

We're introducing two new Skills: /simplify and /batch. I have been using both daily, and am excited to share them with everyone.

Combined, these kills automate much of the work it used to take to (1) shepherd a pull request to production and (2) perform straightforward, parallelizable code migrations.

Claude Code Remote is rolling out now for Pro users


Noah Zweben (@noahzweben)

Rolling out Claude Code Remote Control to Pro users - because they deserve to use the bathroom too .
(Team and Enterprise coming soon).

üßª Rolling out to 10% and ramping

1. Update to claude v2.1.58+
2. Try log-out and log-in to get fresh flag values.
3. /remote-control

  



‚Äî https://nitter.net/noahzweben/status/2027460961884639663#m

RT by @bcherny: 4% of GitHub public commits are being authored by Claude Code right now. At the current trajectory, we believe that Claude Code will be 20%+ of all daily commits by the end of 2026. While you blinked, AI consumed all of software development.

Anthony Morris „ÉÑ (@amorriscode)

I‚Äôm going to start running office hours for users of Claude Code on desktop.

2 hours every Wednesday. 15 minute slots.

Bring your feature requests or frustrations and help shape the future!

I‚Äôll post the sign up form next week.

So much of what makes Claude Code great came from feedback from OSS developers. Excited we can give back a little.
So much of what makes Claude Code great came from feedback from OSS developers. Excited we can give back a little.


Lydia Hallie ‚ú® (@lydiahallie)

Excited to announce Claude for Open Source ‚ù§Ô∏è

We're giving 6 months of free Claude Max 20x to open source maintainers and core contributors.

If you maintain a popular project or contribute across open source, please apply!

claude.com/

RT by @bcherny: We've rolled out a new auto-memory feature.

Claude now remembers what it learns across sessions ‚Äî your project context, debugging patterns, preferred approaches ‚Äî and recalls it later without you having to write anything down.
We've rolled out a new auto-memory feature.

Claude now remembers what it learns across sessions ‚Äî your project context, debugging patterns, preferred approaches ‚Äî and recalls it later without you having to write anything down.

Video

RT by @bcherny: Bun v1.3.10
- Fixes 155 issues (addressing 642 üëç)
- `bun repl` - native JS/TS repl
- Windows ARM64
- ECMAScript decorators
- Faster event loop
- Barrel file import optimization
- Faster structuredClone, Buffer.slice, path.parse

Thanks 11 contributors!
https://bun.com/blog/bun-v1.3.10
Bun v1.3.10
- Fixes 155 issues (addressing 642 üëç)

- Windows ARM64
- ECMAScript decorators
- Faster event loop
- Barrel file import optimization
- Faster structuredCl

RT by @bcherny: New in Cowork: scheduled tasks.

Claude can now complete recurring tasks at specific times automatically: a morning brief, weekly spreadsheet updates, Friday team presentations.
New in Cowork: scheduled tasks.

Claude can now complete recurring tasks at specific times automatically: a morning brief, weekly spreadsheet updates, Friday team presentations.

üêû GH auth is required to see Code pane on mobile (you can still deeplink to your session via QR/link)
‚úÖ Plan mode and AskUserQuestion should be fixed

R to @bcherny: The people who build Claude Code, and everyone across Anthropic, are the reason any of this happened. 

Same goes for every developer who's been building with us, breaking things, and telling us about it. You've all made this better than we could on our own.

Lots more to do.
The people who build Claude Code, and everyone across Anthropic, are the reason any of this happened. 

Same goes for every developer who's been building with us, breaking things, and telling us about it. You

We shipped Claude Code as a research preview a year ago today.

Developers have used it to build weekend projects, ship production apps, write code at the world's largest companies, and help plan a Mars rover drive.

We built it, and you showed us what it was for.
